intro: Eugenia sapoensis, commonly known as the Sapo ebony, is a tropical evergreen tree native to West Africa. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its dark, dense wood and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by edible, dark purple berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and timber quality, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
